Name: Hornet
Builder: Newport News Shipbuilding, Newport News, Virginia
Reclassified:
CV to CVA-12, 1 October 1952
CVA to CVS-12, 27 June 1958
Status: Museum ship at the USS Hornet Museum in Alameda, California
Displacement:
27,100 long tons (27,500 t) (standard)
36,380 long tons (36,960 t) (full load)
processing systems:
1 × SK early-warning radar
1 × SC early-warning radar
1 × SG surface search radar
1 × SM height-finding radar
2 × Mk 4 fire-control radars
Armament:
4 × twin, 4 × single 5 in (127 mm) DP guns
8 × quadruple 40 mm (1.6 in) AA guns
46 × single 20 mm (0.8 in) AA guns
Armor:
Waterline belt: 2.5–4 in (64–102 mm)
Deck: 1.5 in (38 mm)
Hangar deck: 2.5 in (64 mm)
Bulkheads: 4 in (102 mm)
